poem:
### Light's Illusion

Oh, modern alchemy—  
light conjured in tiny fires,  
promising renewal.  
Teeth gleam under the red's spell,  
skin softens in ghostly glow;  
a wizardry of wires.  
Yet here in solitude,  
the ancient sun dissolves mist,  
nature's balm, untouched  
by circuitry's cold promise.
